Intervention: zoledronic acid 4 mg on day 1 of the 4 week treatment period
Eligibility: Subjects 18 years of age or older with prostate cancer or breast cancer with metastatic bone disease
At least one metastatic bone injury confirmed by X-ray
No change in cancer treatment for at least 8 weeks prior to randomisation
Have already been exposed to bisphosphonate
Have had hip fractures or bilateral hip prosthesis fractures of any kind or bone surgery in the last 12 months
Insufficiency of renal function or low haemoglobin

Inadequate hepatic function demonstrated by serum bilirubin twice the upper limits of the reference range (ULRR) or by alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST) or ALP 2.5 times ULRR ( 5 times ULRR in the presence of liver metastases).
Results: - Rate of change from baseline in beta-terminal type I cross-link telopeptide (betaCTX) at week 4
Result at week 4 minus result at the base as a percentage of the result at the base, based on converted log data.
Description of the arm/group: AZD0530 (saracatinib) 175 mg once daily
Unit of measure: Percentage change in betaCTX -71.1 (-75.9 to -65.4)
Title of arm/group: Zoledronic acid 4 mg
Description of the arm/group: Zoledronic acid 4 mg on day 1 of the 4 week treatment period
Unit of measure: Percentage change in betaCTX -68.4 (-73.0 to -63.2)
